intro: Erodium pulverulentum var. tunetanum, commonly known as the Tunisian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with erect stems and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
